comments: In addition to teaching the basics of staffing in HR, this class will teach you the correct way to find and get hired to a job, making it valuable for everyone. Professor is a little confusing but I\'m glad I took this class with her, because she knows what she\'s talking about.

If you take her online prepare yourself for a massive loads of forums, papers, responses & projects. Work is easy as long as you can keep up with her schedule. Due dates and times change constantly and the overall class is VERY UNORGANIZED. She barely ever answers e-mails or forum questions. Take her class only if YOU are very organized.

I think this professor is often misunderstood. She is energetic and hardworking and she wants to model that behavior, though at times she seems to be belittling the students. Her guidance on resume writing is very valuable and she has strong convictions about your success. Her coursework is very disorganized but her leniency makes up for it.

I will start by saying that she is a very nice lady, BUT she keeps you in class for 3hrs without a break, never responds to her e-mails, changes the syllabus on weekly basis, assigns weekly assignments which consist of quizzes, reports, papers, etc. GOOD POINTS: there\'s no tests, no textbook required.

I will start by saying that her syllabus is all over the place and changes on weekly basis. She does not give out tests! Lots of weekly hw such as quizzes, papers, reports etc. Keeps her students in class for 3 hrs without a break! Talks a lot, but overall very nice lady. You also barely use the textbook, so I wouldn\'t bother buying it.

Her online classes are difficult to understand although it is tedious and easy. She doesn\'t make it clear what EXACTLY you need to have done for the class and when it is due. She also changes the syllabus a week through the class. Syllabus and requirements are all over the place. Very unorganized especially in her online classes.

Does not follow her own syllabus. Seems to forget what she has requested of her classes, or confuses assignments. "Does not believe there is a perfect paper," her own quote. Slow to respond via e-mail. Tries to be helpful. Read the book yourself, just don\'t go too far ahead because she may not get that far with the class.

I think she was very knowledgeable abou the subject, she\'s brilliant and she\'s willing to help you w/ resumes and CV. Nevertheless i thought the assignments were busy work, although easy. The midterm was a pain in the butt

She is SO disorganized, & never knows what she assigned or what is due. NEVER responds to email, not helpful at all. Forgets to give us break in 3 hour class because she loves to hear herself talk and won\'t shut up long enough to look at a clock. Can talk for hours on any subject...and she will. The work is easy if you can get over her suckiness
Denise Sawyer Johnson is an amazing teacher. She is hilarious and has great speakers come to class. Take her you will not regret it!!

This teacher was great! I actually liked coming to her class. it was three hours long but never felt like it. She is funny and has great stories. As the other person said, maybe her syllabus has mistakes but she corrects them and is very clear about what is due when. Midterm & Final are take home. One of my favorite teachers ever.

For teaching an organizational behavior class, she is pretty unorganized. Never responds to your emails. Syllabus had errors- she corrected them and redistributed, but they were copied in B&W-the days where assignmetns were due were highlighted RED! First exam had 7 duplicate questions out of 17. Nevertheless, VERY KNOWLEDGEABLE on subject matter
